main event: Several unidentified flying objects were observed over Reseda, California, on March 6, 1957 and April 12, 1957.
interesting points: The first observation described an object approximately the size of a DC-8 with illuminated flight and blinking lights, observed at an altitude of 1000 to 1800 feet., One report indicated a circular, silvery-white object surrounded by an elliptical light, moving in an unusual manner., A resident reported an object moving at high speed before hovering and disappearing., The sightings occurred under various weather conditions, including overcast skies., No photographs are available to corroborate the sightings, but the reports were based on credible eyewitness accounts.
sighted object: unidentified flying objects, one described as approximately the size of a DC-8 and another as a circular silvery-white object
witness description: one observer was a retired U.S. Navy Lt. Commander and the other was a civilian resident
